summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for whom discovery materials are being transmitted.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal communication from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It transmits the password for a drive containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The letter is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was likely held.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York as of November 9, 2020.
